name: Chanterelle
description: The Chanterelle (Cantharellus cibarius), also called Golden Chanterelle, is one of the most popular and well-known edible mushrooms in Europe. With its egg-yolk yellow color, fruity aroma and slightly peppery taste, it is highly prized in cuisine. As a mycorrhizal fungus, it grows in symbiosis with trees in mixed forests. Chanterelles contain antiviral, antioxidant and antibiotic compounds.
